name: Days Inn Salem

reviews.title: Perfectly pleasant experience
reviews.text: Having spent the entire day exploring the Columbia River Gorge and Mt. Hood, we were exhausted and ready for a much needed good nights sleep. After consulting our AAA tourbook we opted to stop at the Black Bear Inn to check on availability for the evening. Rooms were available and we opted for a room on the first floor. This is a motel with exterior doors which we find very convenient for one night stays. The room was pleasant, nothing fancy but certainly accommodating. What we noticed about the entire property is that it was immaculate. We did not use the pool so I cannot comment on that. The breakfast was quite good and served in a separate building that is obviously used for meetings/gatherings. It was nice to have plenty of table space for everyone and there was no need to gobble down breakfast to relinquish your table to waiting guests. Although I-5 is very close we did not notice traffic noise. There were multiple restaurants within close proximity.

reviews.title: It's seen better days
reviews.text: I picked this place because the pool pictures looked enticing. I was looking forward to a swim, and perhaps a sauna.

reviews.title: Don't stay here, you'll be sorry
reviews.text: The establishment itself was...well, marginally okay. It's not seedy, just very much in need of a renovation. The folks at the front desk were friendly, and the bear statues everywhere were cute.

reviews.title: The room stunk
reviews.text: But the room was very tired-looking, with a sour/musty smell I had to dissipate with some air freshener (I've learned to bring a can of it with me on my travels). I'm NOT a picky, meticulous guest, and eventually I did get a good night's sleep (the traffic noise wasn't a problem for me). But it was at the lower end of what I find acceptable, and definitely at the low end of what I'd expect in a Best Western.

reviews.title: Not bad, not bad at all!
reviews.text: Yet the recreational facilities were the biggest disappointment. The indoor pool was like a neglected relic from the sixties. The saunas were unappetizing. The "playground" was an ominous-looking concoction of rubber tires nailed to timber. I couldn't imagine my kids wanting to play there. I certainly didn't want to swim in that pool.

reviews.title: It's an okay place to stay
reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel on business. Being a government employee and limited to hotels that offer the government rate, I was limited in my choices. Other reviews in Trip Advisor said it was good, and my travel-mate colleague being interested in the big pool it has, I decided to stay there.

reviews.title: Nice for an older hotel
reviews.text: The pluses: It's convenient to the freeway and downtown, clean, and fairly comfortable. The pool, my colleague informed me, was nice. It is also relatively inexpensive. Staff were helpful and polite, even going so far as to take my colleague's shirt to the dry-cleaner's for him. It's also near to several restaurants including a Denny's, and a Fred Meyer store (if you're not familiar with Fred Meyers, they are sort of the original Walmart, only the quality of what they carry is much better and the prices correspondingly a bit higher. But there isn't much you can't buy there.) It's got a small fridge and a microwave, too, in the rooms.

reviews.title: This is a great find!
reviews.text: The minuses: It's near the freeway and therefore noisy; the free breakfast is...well, let's say if you actually ate it, you'd pay for it...eeewww. My colleague liked it okay, but admitted that was because it was free. The food was lousy. The bed was fairly hard, too, which, if you prefer that , would be fine.

description: The Days Inn Black Bear has 101 rooms and offers a complimentary Full, Hot breakfast every morning. The friendly, helpful staff at the Days Inn is ready to ensure an enjoyable stay for guests traveling on both business and pleasure. Located near Interstate 5 in Salem, Oregon the hotel offers all of the amenities to make a guest feel right at home. Our property has a Indoor heated pool and sps, exercise facility and two saunas. A tennis court and playground are also on site. Free over-sized vehicle parking and guest laundry facilities are also available for your convenience. All of the rooms have microwaves and refrigerators as well as irons and ironing boards and hair dryers. All have access to premium cable channels including HBO and free wifi. Pets are welcome for a $11 a day pet fee.
